Class User

java.lang.Object
edu.tamu.csce331.sharetea.models.User
public class User extends Object
User model representing employees in the Sharetea POS system.

This class encapsulates all user-related information including authentication credentials, personal details, role assignments, and account metadata. Users represent employees who have access to the POS system with different permission levels based on their assigned roles.

Key features:

  • User identification and authentication support
  • Role-based access control integration
  • Personal information management
  • Account creation and modification tracking
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • User

      public User()
      Default constructor for User.

      Creates a new User instance with default values. This constructor is typically used when creating new user accounts that will be populated with data from user input or database operations.

    • User

      public User(Long userId, String username, String fullName, Integer roleId, String email)
      Constructs a User with specified basic information.

      This constructor is used when creating a User with known basic information. The createdAt timestamp is not set and should be handled separately if needed.

      Parameters:
      userId - the unique identifier for the user
      username - the username for login purposes
      fullName - the full display name of the user
      roleId - the role identifier for permission management
      email - the email address for communication

    • isManager

      public boolean isManager()
      Checks if this user has manager privileges.

      This method determines if the user has manager-level access based on their role ID. Manager privileges typically include access to administrative functions, reporting capabilities, and user management features.

      Returns:
      true if the user has manager privileges (role ID = 1), false otherwise

    • isCashier

      public boolean isCashier()
      Checks if this user has cashier privileges.

      This method determines if the user has cashier-level access based on their role ID. Cashier privileges typically include order processing, payment handling, and basic menu management functions.

      Returns:
      true if the user has cashier privileges (role ID = 2), false otherwise
